Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Uperin 3.6 (U3.6, natural AMPs; UCLL1c; toad, amphibians, animals; XXA; ZZHa_t)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity:  Active against L. lactis (MIC 3 ug/ml), S. uberis (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), S. epidermidis (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), B. cereus (MIC 25 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 25 ug/ml), P.multocida (MIC > 100 ug/ml), M. luteus (MIC 25 ug/ml), and L. innocua (MIC 50 ug/ml). This peptide could inhibit HIV infection at a concentration that is also toxic to T cells (J Virol 2005; 79:11598-11606).Structure:  Helical structure in 50% TFE.  Updated Jan2001; CW 4/2019; 7/2021.
Literature Information.Author: Bradford AM, Raftery MJ, Bowie JH, Tyler MJ, Wallace JC, Adams GW, Severini C.1996, Australia
Literature Information.Title: New antibiotic uperin peptides from the dorsal glands of the australian toadlet Uperoleia mjobergii.
